snippet: The number of applications for unemployment benefits rose 17,000 last week, but an economist said the numbers were still a reason to be optimistic about growth.
abstract: Labor Dept reports weekly applications for unemployment benefits rose 17,000 to seasonally adjusted 298,000; number remains low enough to suggest continuation of solid job growth.
lead_paragraph: The number of applications for unemployment benefits rose 17,000 last week, but an economist said the numbers were still a reason to be optimistic about growth.

headline.main: More Jobless File Claims, but Hopes Stay Strong
headline.print_headline: More Jobless File Claims, but Hopes Stay Strong
